intro: Epacris fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. Epacris fimbriata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens.
